archetype_name: Family Turkish & North African Suppers (Medium, 30–60, Intermediate)
name: Crispy Baked Börek with Spiced Beef & Potato, Mint Yoghurt, and Matboucha
description: Turkish-style beef and potato börek baked until golden, served with a cool mint yoghurt and a North African matboucha side for a balanced, medium-heat family supper.
prep_steps: Finely chop onions (1 large), parsley (small handful), and mint (small handful).
Melt butter (4 tbsp) for brushing phyllo pastry.
Lay out phyllo pastry and keep covered with a slightly damp towel to prevent drying.
Measure out spices: cumin (2 tsp), paprika (1 tsp), chili flakes (1/2–1 tsp), salt, and black pepper.
cook_steps: Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heat; add onions and cook 3–4 minutes until translucent.
Add beef mince and cook, breaking up, until browned and no longer pink, 5–6 minutes.
Stir in cumin, paprika, chili flakes, salt, and black pepper; cook 1 minute until fragrant.
Add diced potatoes and 1/4 cup water; cover and cook 8–10 minutes, stirring once or twice, until potatoes are just tender and liquid is mostly gone.
Remove from heat and stir in chopped parsley; let filling cool 5 minutes.
Brush a baking tray with melted butter. Lay one sheet of phyllo pastry on a board, brush lightly with butter, then stack a second sheet on top and brush again.
Spoon a line of filling along the long edge, roll into a tight log, and transfer seam-side down to the tray. Repeat to make 4 logs.
Brush tops with remaining butter and sprinkle with sesame seeds.
Bake 22–28 minutes until deep golden and crisp.
While baking, mix yoghurt with minced garlic, chopped mint, a pinch of salt, and a drizzle of olive oil to make mint yoghurt.
Warm matboucha gently in a small pan over low heat or serve at room temperature.
Rest börek 3 minutes, then slice and serve with mint yoghurt and matboucha on the side.
